results.title: FleshPool
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Julie Rrap

results.title: The Deer hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Cimino, John Peverell, Michael Deeley, Barry Spikings, EMI/Parlophone and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The Deer hunter is a stunning epic exploration of the physical and psychological effects of the Vietnam War on three young working class men from a Pennsylvania steel town. The film is influenced by the sumptuous cinema of Visconti and Bertolluci, combining social observation with lavish tableaus of everyday life. From the opening wedding sequence to the nightmarish scenes in a prisoner of war camp, “The Deer Hunter” is a consistently astounding film that refuses to situate itself as either pro or anti War. Rather than tackling the specific history of the Vietnam war, it becomes instead a moving allegory on all war and on the destruction, it reaps on the psyches of both the victor and the conquered. “The Deer Hunter” won an Academy Award for Best Film and remains one of the best films ever made about war. With Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, John Savage and Meryl Streep. The astonishing cinematography is by Vilmos Zsigmond.

results.title: The Decline of Tsarism
results.creator_credit: Ian Thompson and University of Warwick
results.brief_description: Using archival footage, this program studies the military defeats and growing social unrest that resulted in the 1917 abdication of Tzar Nicholas II, ending the Romanov dynasty in Russia.
results.description: Using archival footage, this program studies the military defeats and growing social unrest that resulted in the 1917 abdication of Tzar Nicholas II, ending the Romanov dynasty in Russia.

results.title: The Decameron
results.creator_credit: Pier Pasolini, Franco Rossellini, Alberto Grimaldi and Produzioni Europee Associati
results.brief_description: The first installment of Pasolini’s lively ‘Trilogy of Life’, drawn from famous story cycles (‘The Canterbury Tales’ and ‘The Arabian Nights’ followed). Based on eight of Boccaccio’s tales of sexual deception set mostly around 14th-century Naples, including those of the seducing nuns, the three jealous brothers who murder their sister’s lover, the wizard who could turn his wife into a burro, and the story of a false saint. Pasolini plays Giotto, the fresco painter around whom the various tales revolve. The film won the Special Jury Prize at Berlin in 1971. Cast includes Patrizia Capparelli, Franco Citti, Ninetto Davoli, Angela Luce and Sylvana Magano. In Italian with English subtitles.
